item.title: Oil Hits Nine-Month High Ahead of US Inflation Data
item.description: Oil prices rose to their highest level in almost nine months ahead of U.S. inflation data, and supply concerns continued to underpin prices, Saxo said.

item.title: Kim Yo Jong: What We Know About Kim Jong Un's Sister and Her Role in North Korea
item.description: The dictator’s sister has star power, a rising political profile and is called the country’s de facto No. 2.

item.title: Metals Inch Higher Ahead of U.S. Inflation Print
item.description: Base metals prices were tepidly rising, while gold was flat in early London trading, as investors look to today’s consumer inflation print in the U.S., and how it will affect the dollar and the Fed’s outlook on interest rates.

item.title: Deliveroo Ups Guidance, Boosts Shareholder Returns
item.description: Deliveroo raised its adjusted underlying earnings outlook to between £60-£80 million for the year, and said it will return an extra £250 million to shareholders, after it reported a swing to profit for the first half.

item.title: Europe Is Embarking on a Mining Renaissance. Winning Over Locals Is Proving a Challenge.
item.description: Governments in Portugal and elsewhere on the continent want a secure supply of critical minerals to power the green transition, but opposition is often strong.

item.title: Persimmon Reports Revenue Beat
item.description: Persimmon reported first-half revenue of £1.2 billion, ahead of consensus, and said it expects to complete at least 9,000 home sales this year.

item.title: Novo Nordisk Raises Guidance on Surging Demand
item.description: Novo Nordisk now expects 2023 sales growth of 27%-33% and operating profit growth of 31%-37%, as demand for its Ozempic diabetes drug and Wegovy obesity treatment continued to rise.

item.title: Nikkei Rises 0.8% Amid Yen Weakness, Likely Position Adjustment
item.description: Japan’s Nikkei Stock Average rose 0.8% to close at 32473.65, reversing earlier losses amid the yen’s weakness and likely position adjustment ahead of the U.S. inflation report due later.

item.title: Henkel Raises Full-Year Outlook on Higher Earnings
item.description: Henkel now sees full-year sales growth of between 2.5% and 4.5% organically and adjusted underlying earnings margin of between 11% and 12.5% after sales and earnings increased in the first half.

item.title: Rheinmetall Backs Views as Orders Roll In
item.description: Rheinmetall confirmed its guidance for the year after it posted second-quarter results mostly in line with views and as orders continued to roll in in a defence landscape altered by Russia’s invasion of Ukraine.

item.title: Allianz Backs Operating Profit View
item.description: Allianz reported an operating profit of €3.8 in the second quarter, and reaffirmed its full-year view, as strength in its property-and-casualty segment offset subdued performance in asset management.

item.title: Siemens Turns a Profit, Backs Revenue Growth Views
item.description: Siemens backed its fiscal-year guidance for revenue and EPS but lowered its outlook for digital industries, after it reported a 10% growth in revenue to €18.9 billion in the third quarter, just shy of views.

item.title: India Central Bank Keeps Rate Unchanged as Inflation Slows
item.description: Reserve Bank of India Gov. Shaktikanta Das said the policy committee decided to remain focused on withdrawal of accommodation.

item.title: China Allows Group Tours to More Nations
item.description: China is easing restrictions on group travel further, which will likely give a boost to the global tourism industry.

item.title: U.S. Investment Ban on China Poised to Deepen Divide
item.description: President Biden’s order comes on top of a slowing Chinese economy, Covid lockdowns and rising tensions between the two powers.

item.title: Soft US Inflation Data Shouldn't Mean Sustained Dollar Falls
item.description: U.S. inflation data are expected to add to expectations that the Fed could refrain from raising rates further, but this shouldn’t be enough to cause sustained dollar falls, ING said.

item.title: China's Economy Isn't Ailing---It's 'Evolving': IPO Lawyers Told to Watch Their Language
item.description: Authorities’ recent guidance has sown confusion over what Chinese companies should say.

item.title: Disney Gets Iger's Second Show on the Road
item.description: The entertainment giant used an eventful quarterly report to announce a boost to some of its streaming prices.

item.title: How the Unjammable StarStreak Missile Can Help Ukraine
item.description: After going out of production in 2012, StarStreak missiles are being revived to help Ukraine’s air defense. WSJ examines how the British missile stands out among its peers and why its unique features allow it to see past Russian countermeasures.

item.title: U.S. Ally Promised to Send Aid to Sudan. It Sent Weapons Instead.
item.description: Arms shipments from the United Arab Emirates are fueling a war that has killed more than 3,900 people and run counter to Biden administration efforts to mediate an end to the conflict.
